text:
The get_data_dirs function is useful to debug during a tutorial while a user is not putting the data in the right directory when copying from a pen drive (this happens often).

The example should probably be the 2nd one in a beginner tutorial, to make people a bit more familiar with input types.
title: [MRG] DOC + ENH: tutorial example and get_data_dirs func

title: Pull request merge from GaelVaroquaux/nilearn:tutorial_3d_4d_imgs to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: LGTM but I dont s√©e where `get_data_dir` is used. Shouldn't we advertise it in an example?

For the record, there is a way to include all the examples using a particular function (although it may only be in sphinx-gallery master) which looks like this: ``` .. include:: modules/generated/numpy.linspace.examples .. raw:: html
``` The documentation: http://sphinx-gallery.readthedocs.io/en/stable/advanced_configuration.html#establishing-local-references-to-examples.
title: (6, '', u'doc/manipulating_images/manipulating_images.rst')

text:
> For the record, there is a way to include all the examples using a particular function

Indeed, but I wanted to be specific, rather than exhaustive.

The reference documentation of a function already has an exhaustive list.
title: (6, '', u'doc/manipulating_images/manipulating_images.rst')

text: I am afraid that the lambda user can be puzzled by the output (a list of paths). Maybe we should add a comment somewhere about that? A link to the doc of the function explaining the strategy? Not sure how to advertise it.
title: (14, '', u'examples/plot_3d_and_4d_niimg.py')

text:
I know that this is example but it would be nice, IMHO, to label a bit more what is printed:
`print('Datasets are stored in: ' + datasets.get_data_dirs())`
title: (None, '', u'examples/plot_3d_and_4d_niimg.py')

text:

> of paths). Maybe we should add a comment somewhere about that? A link
> to the doc of the function explaining the strategy? Not sure how to

I can mention that it's a list of path that are tried successively.

On the other hand, on most computers, the list will have only one entry,
so it's not too bad.
